articles.title: You Can Cool Chips With Lasers?!?!
articles.summary: Modern high-performance chips are marvels of engineering, containing tens of billions of transistors. The problem is, you can’t use them all at once. If you did, you would create hot spots—high temperatures concentrated in tiny areas—with power densities nearing those found at the surface of the sun...

articles.title: Electrifying Everything Will Require Multiphysics Modeling
articles.summary: A prototyping problem is emerging in today’s efforts to electrify everything. What works as a lab-bench mockup breaks in reality. articles.title: 4 Weird Things You Can Turn into a Supercapacitor
articles.summary: What do water bottles, eggs, hemp, and cement have in common? They can be engineered into strange, but functional, energy-storage devices called supercapacitors.As their name suggests, supercapacitors are like capacitors with greater capacity.
